SENT.plain: A patient, young fisherman, with a locked-in syndrome is reported, in whom intact consciousness, quadriplegia of spastic type, voluntary eye blinking, (de)sursumvergence and anarthria were observed
Thrombosis of the basilar artery and slightly disturbed bioelectrogenesis of the cerebral cortex were proved by clinical examination
At the autopsy thrombosis a. basilaris and ventrobasal pontine infarction were confirmed
Differential diagnosis of this and similar syndromes has been discussed
